alert.note: Alert for Northwest Blue Mountains (Washington) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Pendleton (Northeast Oregon and Southeast Washington)
info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued January 04 at 10:26PM PST until January 05 at 6:00AM PST by NWS Pendleton
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 6 AM PST FRIDAY ABOVE 4000 FEET... ...WINTER STORM WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM LATE FRIDAY NIGHT THROUGH SUNDAY MORNING ABOVE 3500 FEET... * WHAT...For the Winter Weather Advisory above 4000 feet, snow expected. Additional snow accumulations of 1 to 3 inches possible. For the Winter Storm Watch above 3500 feet, heavy snow possible. Total snow accumulations of 6 to 12 inches possible. * WHERE...In Oregon, Northern Blue Mountains of Oregon. In Washington, Northwest Blue Mountains. * WHEN...For the Winter Weather Advisory, until 6 AM PST Friday. For the Winter Storm Watch, from late Friday night through Sunday morning. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult to impossible. Patchy blowing snow could significantly reduce visibility. The hazardous conditions could impact the morning or evening commute.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling. Monitor the latest forecasts for updates on this situation. The latest road conditions can be obtained for Oregon by calling 5 1 1 or by visiting online at https://tripcheck.com, or for Washington by visiting online at https://wsdot.com/travel.
